laboratory_examinations.findings: Hyponatremia (132 mEq/L), C-reactive protein (2 mg/dL), elevated D-dimer (3608 ng/mL), procalcitonin level (51 microg/L), normal lactates (1.2 mmol/L).

laboratory_examinations.date: Initial - Not specified; Six hours after admission
laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial: Hypoxia (pO2 52 mmHg, SpO2 90%). Six hours after admission: Respiratory and lactic acidosis (pH 7.1, PaO2 45 mmHg, PaCO2 42 mmHg, HCO3- 16.5 mmol/L, BE -15.8 mmol/L, SpO2 73.3% in oxygen therapy FiO2 100%, lactates 9.7 mmol/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial hypoxia progressed to respiratory and lactic acidosis six hours after admission.

laboratory_examinations.date: Initial - Not specified; Repeat after 24 hours
laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial: Right upper lobe opacification. 24 hours later: Complete right upper lobe, right lower and left mid-basal opacification, with diffuse thickening of the bilateral lower-middle lung.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Opacification increased from initial to repeat chest X-ray 24 hours later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for Pseudomonas aeruginosa with a good sensitivity profile.
